message_1: Suppose you have a message consisting of 20 characters, and you want to generate a hash value of 160 bits using the SHA-1 algorithm. What will be the size of the hash output in bytes?
message_2:
The SHA-1 algorithm generates a hash value of 160 bits. To convert bits to bytes, you need to divide the number of bits by 8, as there are 8 bits in a byte.

160 bits / 8 = 20 bytes

So, the size of the hash output using the SHA-1 algorithm for a 20-character message will be 20 bytes.
